page.title: 02THE LERRYN RIVER
page.content: The beauty of the{Lerryn river attracts people for various reasons. Many to "mess about in boats," others to watch birds and wildlife and some to just relax and enjoy it's beauty. The Lerryn river has it's source in the{Boconnoc Estate}and is tidal as far as{Lerryn Bridge. }The river flows into a lake on the Estate and some of the water is diverted into a leat that used to power the{old mill}at{Couch's {Mill.}Water is also diverted into an old leat that fed a mill at Lerryn. The river inspires some people to try and capture it's beauty on paper and canvas. It is said that{Kenneth {Grahame}wrote{"The Wind in the {Willows"}after a river trip to Lerryn from Fowey. { {
